meanings.definition: To damage or spoil the appearance of (something)
meanings.sent1: The muddy footprints were marring the clean floor.
meanings.sent2: The scratches on the car were marring its shiny surface.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy was marring the freshly mopped floor with its wet paws.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was marring the beauty of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops marring the mirror made it difficult to see my reflection clearly.

meanings.definition: To impair the quality or perfection of (something)
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions were marring the flow of the conversation.
meanings.sent2: The noise from the construction site was marring the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent3: The spilled coffee was marring the perfection of her white dress.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were marring the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The crack in the vase was marring its flawless beauty.
